channel.title: committer on The long way through Software Craftsmanship
channel.description: Recent content in committer on The long way through Software Craftsmanship

item.title: Two persons involved in a git commit, in github
item.description: On git You can have multiple persons involved in a single git commit: an author and a committer. The difference is explained by Manuel Doninger 1: The author is the one who did the code change. The committer is the person who committed that change to a repository. an example, by the same author: Example: I’m not a committer in the EGit project, so i have no rights to push directly to the EGit repository at Eclipse.
